post.description: Creates a new chat using a user message, optional system context, and model configuration. Useful for prompting the model within the scope of a specific project.

message.description: Creates a new chat using a user message, optional system context, and model configuration. Useful for prompting the model within the scope of a specific project.

attachments.description: A list of files or assets to be included in the conversation context. Useful when the chat or task requires referencing documents, images, or other resources.

system.description: Provides system-level context or background for the chat. This is typically used to specify frameworks, tools, or development environments relevant to the task.

chatPrivacy.description: Determines the privacy setting of the chat. This can control whether the chat is visible only to the user, to team members, or is public.

projectId.description: Associates the chat with a specific project in your workspace. Helps organize and group related chats under a common project context.

modelId.description: Deprecated Model ID field preserved for backward compatibility.

imageGenerations.description: Enables image generations to generate up to 5 images per version.

thinking.description: Enables thinking to generate a response in multiple steps.

modelConfiguration.description: Settings that control how the model behaves in the chat.

responseMode.description:
Controls how the response is delivered.

- `"sync"`: The response is returned immediately with the HTTP request.
- `"async"`: Returns a message placeholder immediately; use getById to poll for completion status and final output.
- `"experimental_stream"`: Returns content parts as Server-Sent Events for real-time streaming.

designSystemId.description: The ID of a design system to apply to this chat. Design systems provide consistent styling and components for generated UI.

get.description: Retrieves a list of existing chats, with support for pagination and filtering by favorite status. Helps manage and navigate chat history.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of chat records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many chats.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of chat records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many chats.

parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Determines the starting point for pagination. Used in conjunction with limit to retrieve a specific page of chat results.

parameters.description: Determines the starting point for pagination. Used in conjunction with limit to retrieve a specific page of chat results.

parameters.name: isFavorite

schema.description:
Filters chats by their "favorite" status. Accepts `"true"` or `"false"` (as strings, not booleans).

- `"true"`: returns only chats marked as favorites.
- `"false"`: returns only non-favorite chats.

parameters.description:
Filters chats by their "favorite" status. Accepts `"true"` or `"false"` (as strings, not booleans).

- `"true"`: returns only chats marked as favorites.
- `"false"`: returns only non-favorite chats.

post.description: Initializes a new chat from source content such as files, repositories, registries, or zip archives. Enables context-rich conversations based on code or assets.

name.description: A user-defined name for the chat. Helps identify or describe the purpose of the chat session in the UI or API responses.

chatPrivacy.description: Controls the visibility of the chat. Defines whether the chat is private, shared with a team, or publicly accessible.

projectId.description: Associates the chat with a specific project. Useful for organizing and grouping chats in a workspace.

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

locked.description: Whether to lock this file to prevent AI from overwriting it during generation
Whether to lock this file to prevent AI from overwriting it during generation

files.description: An array of inline file objects used to initialize the chat. Each object must contain a file `name` and its `content`.

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

repo.description: Specifies a repository source for initialization. Supports both public and private GitHub repositories. For private repositories, ensure your GitHub account is connected through Vercel.

lockAllFiles.description: Whether to lock all files in the repository to prevent AI from overwriting them during generation

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

registry.description: Allows initialization from a predefined component or code registry. Includes the registry source and identifier for the desired component/module.

lockAllFiles.description: Whether to lock all files from the registry to prevent AI from overwriting them during generation

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

zip.description: Provides a zipped bundle of files as the input source. Typically includes a base64-encoded archive or a remote URL reference.

lockAllFiles.description: Whether to lock all files from the zip archive to prevent AI from overwriting them during generation

type.description: Specifies the initialization method. For this endpoint, it defines the source of content being used to initialize the chat.

templateId.description: The ID of the template to initialize the chat from. This should be a valid template ID from the v0 template system.

delete.description: Deletes a specific chat based on the provided chatId. This operation is irreversible and permanently removes the chat and its contents.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to delete. This must be passed as a path parameter in the URL.

get.description: Retrieves the full details of a specific chat using its `chatId`. Includes messages, metadata, and associated configuration.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to retrieve. Must be provided as a path parameter.

patch.description: Updates the metadata of an existing chat using its `chatId`. Supports changes to the chat name and privacy setting.

name.description: A new name to assign to the chat. Helps with identification and organization.

privacy.description: Sets the privacy level of the chat.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to update. Provided as a path parameter.

put.description: Marks or unmarks a chat as a favorite using its `chatId`. This helps with organizing and quickly accessing important chats.

isFavorite.description:
Specifies whether the chat should be marked as a favorite.

- `"true"`: mark as favorite
- `"false"`: remove from favorites

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to update. Provided as a path parameter.

post.description: Creates a new chat fork (duplicate) from a specific version within an existing chat. Useful for branching off alternate directions without modifying the original conversation.

versionId.description: The identifier of the specific chat version to fork from. If omitted, the latest version will be used.

privacy.description: Determines the privacy setting of the forked chat. This can control whether the chat is visible only to the user, to team members, or is public.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to fork. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Retrieves the v0 project associated with a given chat. Useful for determining the context or scope of a chat session.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The ID of the chat to retrieve the associated project for.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all messages for a specific chat, ordered by creation date (newest first). Supports cursor-based pagination and includes message content, role, and type information.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to retrieve messages for. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of message records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many messages.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of message records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many messages.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Base64 encoded cursor containing pagination data

parameters.description: Base64 encoded cursor containing pagination data

post.description: Creates a new message in an existing chat. Triggers a model response using the provided prompt, with optional attachments and configuration settings.

message.description: The prompt or instruction to send to the model as part of the chat.

attachments.description: A list of files or assets to include with the message.

modelId.description: Deprecated Model ID field preserved for backward compatibility.

imageGenerations.description: Enables image generations to generate up to 5 images per version.

thinking.description: Enables thinking to generate a response in multiple steps.

responseMode.description:
Controls how the response is delivered.

- `"sync"`: The response is returned immediately with the HTTP request.
- `"async"`: Returns a message placeholder immediately; use getById to poll for completion status and final output.
- `"experimental_stream"`: Returns content parts as Server-Sent Events for real-time streaming.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to send the message to. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific message within a chat, including content, files, model configuration, and demo URLs.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat containing the message. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all versions (iterations) for a specific chat, ordered by creation date (newest first). Supports cursor-based pagination and includes version status and demo URLs.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat to retrieve versions for. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of version records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many versions.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of version records to return in a single response. Useful for paginating results when there are many versions.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Base64 encoded cursor containing pagination data

parameters.description: Base64 encoded cursor containing pagination data

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific version of a chat, including all files with their content and lock status.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat containing the version. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the version to retrieve. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: includeDefaultFiles

schema.description: When true, includes all default files (package.json, configuration files, etc.) that would be part of a ZIP download. When false or omitted, returns only the generated source files.

parameters.description: When true, includes all default files (package.json, configuration files, etc.) that would be part of a ZIP download. When false or omitted, returns only the generated source files.

patch.description: Updates the source files of a specific chat version (block) manually. This allows editing generated files directly through the API.

name.description: The full file path including extension (e.g., "components/test.tsx")

content.description: The new content for the file

locked.description: Whether to lock or unlock the file to prevent AI from overwriting it during generation

files.description: Array of files to update with their new content

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat containing the version to update. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the version (block) to update. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Download all files for a specific chat version as a zip or tarball archive. Use includeDefaultFiles=true to include all deployment files (package.json, configuration files, etc.) or false/omitted to return only the generated source files.

schema.description: ZIP archive containing the version files
Gzipped tar archive containing the version files

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat containing the version. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the version to download. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: The archive format for the download. Choose "zip" for broad compatibility or "tarball" for Unix/Linux systems.

parameters.description: The archive format for the download. Choose "zip" for broad compatibility or "tarball" for Unix/Linux systems.

parameters.name: includeDefaultFiles

schema.description: When true, includes all default files (package.json, configuration files, etc.) that would be part of a complete deployment. When false or omitted, returns only the generated source files.

parameters.description: When true, includes all default files (package.json, configuration files, etc.) that would be part of a complete deployment. When false or omitted, returns only the generated source files.

post.description: Resumes processing of a previously interrupted or incomplete message in a chat. Useful for continuing generation when a message was paused or stopped.

parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the chat containing the message to resume. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The identifier of the specific message to resume. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Find deployments by project and chat IDs. This will return a list of deployments for the given project and chat IDs.

post.description: Create a new deployment for a specific chat and version. This will trigger a deployment to Vercel.

get.description: Get a deployment by ID. This will return the details of the deployment, including the inspector URL, chat ID, project ID, version ID, API URL, and web URL.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Path parameter "deploymentId"

delete.description: Delete a deployment by ID. This will delete the deployment from Vercel.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Path parameter "deploymentId"

get.description: Retrieves logs for a specific deployment. Supports filtering by timestamp to fetch only recent logs.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the deployment to retrieve logs for. Provided as a path parameter.

parameters.name: since

schema.description: A UNIX timestamp (in seconds) used to filter logs. Returns only log entries generated after the specified time.

parameters.description: A UNIX timestamp (in seconds) used to filter logs. Returns only log entries generated after the specified time.

get.description: Retrieves a list of errors that occurred during a specific deployment. Useful for diagnosing and debugging deployment issues.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the deployment to inspect for errors. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Retrieves a list of existing hooks in your workspace. Useful for managing active webhooks tied to chat events or deployments.

post.description: Creates a new webhook that listens for specific events. Supports optional association with a chat.

name.description: A human-readable name for the hook.

events.description: List of event types the hook should subscribe to.

chatId.description: The ID of a chat to scope the hook to.

url.description: The target URL to receive the webhook payloads.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific webhook using its ID.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the hook to retrieve.

patch.description: Updates the configuration of an existing webhook, including its name, event subscriptions, or target URL.

name.description: A new name for the hook.

events.description: Updated list of event types to subscribe to.

url.description: A new URL to send webhook payloads to.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook to update. Provided as a path parameter.

delete.description: Deletes a webhook based on its ID. This action is irreversible.

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: The ID of the webhook to delete. Provided as a path parameter.

get.description: Retrieves a list of Vercel projects linked to your integration. Useful for associating chats, deployments, or hooks with specific Vercel projects.

post.description: Links a Vercel project to an existing v0 project. Enables Vercel-related features and deployment integration within the v0 workspace.

projectId.description: The ID of the v0 project to link to the new Vercel project.

name.description: The name to assign to the new Vercel project.

get.description: Returns a list of all v0 projects in your workspace. Useful for browsing or managing projects across different chats or use cases.

post.description: Creates a new v0 project with an optional description, icon, environment variables, and instructions. Projects help organize chats and manage context.

name.description: The name of the project.

description.description: A brief summary of the project’s purpose.

icon.description: An icon identifier to visually represent the project.

environmentVariables.description: A list of key-value pairs used to define runtime variables for the project.

instructions.description: Guidance or goals that provide context for the model when working within the project.

vercelProjectId.description: The ID of an existing Vercel project to link to. If not provided, a new Vercel project will be created.

privacy.description: The privacy setting for the project. For user accounts, this is always "private". For team/enterprise accounts, this can be either "private" or "team".

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific v0 project by its ID.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to retrieve.

patch.description: Updates the metadata of an existing project using its `projectId`. Supports changes to the project name and privacy setting.

name.description: A new name to assign to the project. Helps with identification and organization.

description.description: A new description to assign to the project. Helps with identification and organization.

instructions.description: Guidance or goals that provide context for the model when working within the project.

privacy.description: The privacy setting for the project. For user accounts, this must be "private". For team/enterprise accounts, this can be either "private" or "team".

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to update. Provided as a path parameter.

delete.description: Deletes a specific project based on the provided projectId. This operation marks the project as deleted and is irreversible.

id.description: The unique identifier of the deleted project.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a project.

deleted.description: Confirmation that the project has been deleted.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to delete. This must be passed as a path parameter in the URL.

post.description: Links an existing v0 project to a specific chat. Helps group conversations under a shared project context.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat to assign the project to.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project to assign.

get.description: Retrieves all environment variables for a given project.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project whose environment variables should be retrieved.

parameters.name: decrypted

schema.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

parameters.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

post.description: Creates new environment variables for a given project. This endpoint will fail if any of the specified environment variable keys already exist, unless upsert is set to true.

key.description: The name of the environment variable.

value.description: The value of the environment variable.

environmentVariables.description: An array of environment variables to create with key and value fields.

upsert.description: Whether to overwrite existing environment variables with the same keys. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project where environment variables should be created.

parameters.name: decrypted

schema.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

parameters.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

patch.description: Updates multiple environment variables for a given project. Only the value of each environment variable can be updated.

id.description: The unique identifier of the environment variable to update.

value.description: The new value of the environment variable.

environmentVariables.description: An array of environment variables to update with id and value fields.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project whose environment variables should be updated.

parameters.name: decrypted

schema.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

parameters.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

post.description: Deletes multiple environment variables for a given project by their IDs.

items.description: The unique identifier of the environment variable to delete.

environmentVariableIds.description: An array of environment variable IDs to delete.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project whose environment variables should be deleted.

get.description: Retrieves a specific environment variable for a given project by its ID, including its value.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project that owns the environment variable.

parameters.name: environmentVariableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the environment variable to retrieve.

parameters.name: decrypted

schema.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

parameters.description: Whether to return decrypted values. Defaults to false (encrypted).

get.description: Retrieves rate limit information for a given scope. Useful for monitoring usage limits and avoiding throttling.

parameters.name: scope

schema.description: The context or namespace to check rate limits for (e.g., a project slug or feature area).

parameters.description: The context or namespace to check rate limits for (e.g., a project slug or feature area).

get.description: Retrieves information about the authenticated user, including their ID, name, email, and account metadata.
Fetches billing usage and quota information for the authenticated user. Can be scoped to a specific context (e.g. project or namespace).

parameters.name: scope

schema.description: Filters billing data by a specific scope, such as a project ID or slug.

parameters.description: Filters billing data by a specific scope, such as a project ID or slug.

get.description: Returns the current subscription plan for the authenticated user, including tier details and feature limits.
Retrieves all accessible scopes for the authenticated user, such as personal workspaces or shared teams.

Retrieves detailed usage events for the authenticated user or team, including costs, event types, models used, and metadata. Shows the same data as displayed in the usage dashboard. Can be filtered by chatId to show usage for a specific chat.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a chat.

shareable.description: Indicates whether the chat can be shared via public link.

privacy.description: Defines the visibility of the chat—private, team-only, or public.

name.description: An optional name assigned to the chat by the user.

title.description: Deprecated title field preserved for backward compatibility.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the chat was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the last update to the chat.

favorite.description: Indicates whether the chat is marked as a favorite.

authorId.description: The ID of the user who created the chat.

projectId.description: Optional ID of the v0 project associated with this chat.

webUrl.description: Web URL to view this chat in the browser.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this chat via the API.

id.description: A unique identifier for the version.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a version.

status.description: The current status of the version generation process.

demoUrl.description: Optional URL for previewing the generated output.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the version was created, in ISO 8601 format.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the version was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a file.

name.description: The name of the file, including its extension.

content.description: The full contents of the file as a raw string.

locked.description: Whether the file is locked to prevent AI from overwriting it during new version generation.

items.description: Detailed representation of a file, including its content and lock status.

files.description: A list of files that were generated or included in this version.

screenshotUrl.description: URL to retrieve a screenshot of this version.

latestVersion.description: Full details of the most recent generated version, if available.

url.description: The canonical URL to access this chat.

id.description: A unique identifier for the message.

object.description: Fixed value identifying this object as a message.

content.description: The main text content of the message.

anyOf.description: AST content section containing parsed markdown/MDX nodes
Metadata section containing title and other properties

experimental_content.description: The parsed content of the message as an array structure containing AST nodes. This is an experimental field that may change.

createdAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was created.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was last updated.

type.description: Indicates the format or category of the message, such as plain text or code.

role.description: Specifies whether the message was sent by the user or the assistant.

finishReason.description: The reason why the message generation finished.

apiUrl.description: API URL to access this message via the API.

parentId.description: The ID of the parent message.

items.description: Summary of a single message within a chat, including role, content, type, timestamp, and API URL.

messages.description: All messages exchanged in the chat, including user and assistant entries.

lang.description: Programming language used in the file (e.g., JavaScript, Python).

meta.description: A key-value map of metadata associated with the file (e.g., path, type).

source.description: The origin or identifier of the file source (e.g., path or upload label).

files.description: Optional array of files associated with the chat context.

demo.description: Deprecated demo URL used for previewing the chat result.

text.description: The main user prompt or instruction that started the chat.

modelId.description: Deprecated Model ID field preserved for backward compatibility.

imageGenerations.description: Enables image generations to generate up to 5 images per version.

thinking.description: Enables thinking to generate a response in multiple steps.

modelConfiguration.description: The configuration used to generate responses in this chat.

write.description: If true, the user has write access to the chat.

Metadata section containing title and other properties

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp representing when the message was last updated.

type.description: Indicates the format or category of the message, such as plain text or code.

role.description: Specifies whether the message was sent by the user or the assistant.

finishReason.description: The reason why the message generation finished.

parentId.description: The ID of the parent message.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat to which this message belongs.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat.

title.description: Deprecated title field preserved for backward compatibility.

updatedAt.description: The ISO timestamp of the last update to the chat.

favorite.description: Indicates whether the chat is marked as a favorite.
